<Text: Assaf Shelleg:  He was previously the Schusterman Visiting Assistant Professor of Musicology and Jewish Studies in the Department of Religious Studies at the University of Virginia (2011–14), and had taught prior to that as the visiting Efroymson Scholar in the Jewish, Islamic & Near Eastern Languages and Cultures Department at Washington University in St. Louis (2009–11).

"Jewish Contiguities and the Soundtrack of Israeli History"
4:
--------------------
Text: Assaf Shelleg:  The book studies the emergence of modern Jewish art music in central and Western Europe (1910s-1930s) and its translocation to Palestine/Israel (1930s-1970s), exposing the legacies of European antisemitism and religious Judaism in the making of Israeli art music.
Triplets:<Assaf Shelleg
5:
--------------------
Text: Assaf Shelleg:  Moving to consider the dislocation of modern Jewish art music the book examines the paradoxes embedded in a Zionist national culture whose rhetoric negated its pasts, only to mask process of hybridizations enchained by older legacies.
Triplets:<Assaf Shelleg
